channel.title: People cant connect to my server
channel.description:
[ul][li]I've portforwarded correctly, (checked with canyouseeme.org)[/li] [li]my no-ip is running fine[/li] [li]The only thing I changed for the ip was in the client.java[/li][/ul]
I am using empirescape (although I have this problem in every server) http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=481264.0 and I can't figure out what the problem is. If it helps to know, I am on a laptop. I am the only one that can connect. :confused:
[IMG]http://img29.imageshack.us/img29/9236/noipdesktop2.png[/img] [IMG]http://img844.imageshack.us/img844/4007/noip22real.png[/img] [IMG]http://img191.imageshack.us/img191/993/newmyport.png[/img]

item.title: People cant connect to my server

@zadehogan wrote:

You have to switch the gamestub.java too.

Read full topic
item.source: People cant connect to my server

item.title: People cant connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @Dharma Dharma
item.description:
@Dharma wrote:

[quote=“bears371, post:13, topic:452398”][quote author=Dharma link=topic=555277.msg4065543#msg4065543 date=1343854235]
If you want to login to your server use this ip in your client: 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0

If you want other people to be able to join, go into your client change your client IP to your no-ip.

[/quote] I switched the 127.0.0.1 that was in client.java with erik123.no-ip.biz, I was always able to connect, just not anybody else.[/quote]

PM me. I’ll teamviewer you and see what the problem is.

Read full topic

item.title: People cant connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @Armend555 Armend555
item.description:
@Armend555 wrote:

porting forward only lets your router open up for the port needed open.
Your firewall on the other hand can see the connection coming in from the port as an attack or so.
shot answer: No.
if you need personal help we can do teamwiever its very popular here as i can see. sry for my bad english btw

cheers,

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @pro_banana pro banana
item.description:
@pro_banana wrote:

Did you try logging in with your normal IP? not the no-ip one.

It’s also possible that you didn’t compile right or that the old ip is still in there somewhere.
